trial_identification.studytitle: The 2VAL Study: A trial comparing the effect of valacyclovir and valganciclovir prophylaxis against cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection after renal transplantation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomized trial comparing valacyclovir versus valganciclovir prophylaxis of cytomegalovirus infection in renal transplant recipients

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents

interventions.interventions: Oral valacyclovir (VALTREX, Glaxo Wellcome) 8g/day for 3 months after transplantation started within 1 week post transplant
interventions.comparator: Oral valganciclovir (VALCYTE, Roche) 900mg/day for 3 months after transplantation started within 1 week post transplant

primaryOutcome.outcome: Active cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection (DNAemia = presence of CMV viremia by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for CMV deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) test )
Incidence and severity of interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy (IF/TA) assesed at Months 36 protocol biopsy

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Cumulative incidence of CMV disease, defined by clinical symptoms + presence of CMV viremia by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for CMV deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) test
Presumed and clinical acute rejection assessed by laboratory tests (renal function impairement) and renal allograft biopsy with the inclusion of histologic findings of "borderline rejection"
Subclinical acute rejection at Months 3 protocol biopsy
IF/TA and chronic rejection at Months 3 protocol biopsy
Level of CMV specific CD4 and CD8 T-lymphocyte immune response assessed by blood analysis
Lymphocyte function before and after withdrawal of antivirotics assessed by blood analysis and in vitro lymfocyte stimulation tests
renal function assessed by serum creatinine and estimated glomerular filtration rate
other infections assessed by clinical symptoms, microbiological cultures, blood tests

adverse events based on prospective observation (examples od side effects - heamatological - leukopenia, trombocytopenia, anemia, psychiatric - hallucinations+confusion, liver enzyme abnormalities, de novo post transplant diabetes, de novo malignancy, etc.)
Cumulative patient and graft survival based on prospective observation
Costs related to CMV management based on prospective resource data collection
Messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) expression of selected cytokines in renal tissue at Months 36 protocol biopsy

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Recipients of transplant from deceased or living donor, known donor (D) and recipient (R) CMV serology before transplantation of D+/R- or D+/R+ or D-/R+, provided informed consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unknown or D-/R- CMV serology prior to transplantation, systemic antiviral drug intake within 2 weeks before transplantation except for hepatitis B therapy (lamivudine, adefovir, entecavir), active viral infection at the time of transplantation (except for hepatitis B or C), significant leukopenia or thrombocytopenia, participation in another clinical trial, known allergy to (val)acyclovir or (val)ganciclovir, inability to provide informed concent

trial_design.concealment: All subjects indicated to kidney transplantation were considered for inclusion to the trial prior to transplantation. If the patient met inclusion criteria and signed informed consent randomization occurred. Hidden numbered envelops containing the treatment arm were used. Thus the treatment arm was consealed to the researcher until the patient had been included to the trial.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: There are two major hypothesis to test: 1) Valacyclovir prophylaxis for cytomegalovirus infection is not inferior than valganciclovir prophylaxis in the prevention of active cytomegalovirus infection and disease. 2) Valacyclovir is superior to valganciclovir in the prevention of indirect effects of cytomegalovirus: acute renal allograft rejection in short term follow up, and renal function and chronic interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy (IF/TA) in long-term follow up.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Reischig T, Prucha M, Sedlackova L, Lysak D, Jindra P, Bouda M, Matejovic M. Valganciclovir prophylaxis against cytomegalovirus impairs lymphocyte proliferation and activation in renal transplant recipients. Antivir Ther 2011, 16: 1227-1235.
